intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium pietroszense subsp. pietroszense, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Europe. It typically grows in rocky and gravelly soils at high elevations. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves with hairy surfaces and produces yellow flowers in late summer. Its inflorescence consists of a single, terminal capitulum with tubular florets. It is adapted to cold climates and has a low-growing habit to withstand harsh mountain conditions.
